intro: Pedicularis stenocorys var. pseudostenocorys, commonly known as the narrow-crown lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes species that are often parasitic or hemiparasitic. This variant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species within its native range.
